panels.content:
(your name) - UCS Traffic Monitoring - Domain Traffic

Detailed traffic monitoring of the selected UCS Domain
UCS Domain $domain_name with IP $domain located in $domain_location

panels.description: Combined Inbound and outbound Ethernet traffic on UCS Domain - $domain

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth' AND "channel" != '') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "TX Traffic" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth' AND "channel" != '') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport fill(linear)

panels.title: Ethernet Traffic - Total

panels.description: Combined Inbound and outbound FC traffic on UCS Domain - $domain

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC' AND "channel" != '') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "TX Traffic" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC' AND "channel" != '') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport fill(linear)

panels.title: FC Traffic - Total

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization (% and bps) and the blade servers that are sending/receiving traffic over that uplink port. Did you receive high utilization or congestion alert on an uplink port and you want to know why or who caused it? Look here to find the top-talker blade server(s) who contributed most to the uplink utilization. **How to use**: Select a UCS domain, FI (A or B) and an *Uplink* (Not the *Uplink Port Channel*). The RX and TX traffic graphs are auto-generated side-by-side along with the traffic breakdown per blade server. To use the output: - Look at Left Y-axis for utilization in (Giga or Mega) bits per second and Right Y-axis for utilization in %. - *Util Max* shows max speed of uplink. *% Max* always shows 100%. - Displayed service profiles have vNIC/vHBA pinned to this uplink and hence, contributing to the traffic on this port. - Click on avg or current values to sort according to the utilization. You can select more than one values or All from *Uplink*. Looking at everything together can be useful when you don't know where to start or while doing routine monitoring. But it is better to focus on one uplink at a time and not get overwhelmed by too much information at the same time. **Details**: - The displayed uplink utilization is slightly higher (1.1x) than the sum of the utilization of all blade servers to prevent overlapping in the graph. You can safely ignore this observation. - It is possible to display the traffic breakdown per vNIC/vHBA but that will make this graph too busy. Traffic breakdown at per vNIC/vHBA level is available on the page dedicated for Blade server monitoring which you should be able to use one you have a suspected blade server (service profile name)

targets.query: SELECT (mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]])/(mean("oper_speed")*1000000000) AS "RX % Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT last("oper_speed")/last("oper_speed") AS "RX % MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]) AS "RX Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-$fi_id $uplink traffic breakdown - RX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization (% and bps) and the blade servers that are sending/receiving traffic over that uplink port. Traffic breakdown at per vNIC/vHBA level is available on the page dedicated for Blade server monitoring which you should be able to use one you have a suspected blade server (service profile name)

targets.query: SELECT (mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]])/(mean("oper_speed")*1000000000) AS "TX % Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/[[polling_interval]] AS "TX" FROM "VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "pinned_uplink" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m), "service_profile" fill(linear)

SELECT last("oper_speed")  *1000000000 AS "TX Util MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT last("oper_speed")/last("oper_speed") AS "TX % MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]) AS "TX Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-$fi_id $uplink traffic breakdown - TX
Uplink traffic distribution per service profile (Use 'Uplink')

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port-channel utilization (% and bps), member ports and traffic distribution. In other words, verify uniform utilization of all links in a port-channel. **How to use**: Select a UCS domain, FI (A or B) and a port-channel from the *Uplink Port Channel* drop down. The RX and TX traffic graphs are auto-generated side-by-side. To use the output: - Look at Left Y-axis for utilization in (Giga or Mega) bits per second and Right Y-axis for utilization in %. - *Util Max* shows aggregated speed of the port-channel. *% Max* always shows 100%. - Displayed physical ports are the members of the port-channel. Verify their traffic rate and distribution. You can select more than one values or All from *Uplink Port Channel*. The RX and TX graphs are auto-generated for all the selected values. You may want to look at everything when you don't know the root cause of the problem or if you are just doing routine monitoring. But it is better to focus on one port-channel at a time and not get overwhelmed by too much information at the same time. **Details**: - The displayed port-channel utilization is slightly higher than the sum of the utilization of all member ports. This is done to avoid overlapping in the graph by multiplying port-channel utilization by 1.1. You can safely ignore this observation. - The options under *Uplink Port Channel* drop-down are automatically updated based on the selected UCS domain and FI (A or B)

targets.query: SELECT (mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/[[polling_interval]]) AS "RX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]])/(mean("oper_speed")*1000000000) AS "RX %" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000)/(mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000) AS "RX % MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]) AS "RX Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000) AS "RX Util MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000) AS "RX Util MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-$fi_id $uplink_pc traffic breakdown - RX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port-channel utilization (% and bps), member ports and traffic distribution. In other words, verify uniform utilization of all links in a port-channel. **How to use**: Select a UCS domain, FI (A or B) and a port-channel from the *Uplink Port Channel* drop down. The RX and TX traffic graphs are auto-generated side-by-side. To use the output: - Look at Left Y-axis for utilization in (Giga or Mega) bits per second and Right Y-axis for utilization in %. - *Util Max* shows aggregated speed of the port-channel. *% Max* always shows 100%. - Displayed physical ports are the members of the port-channel. Verify their traffic rate and distribution. You can select more than one values or All from *Uplink Port Channel*. The RX and TX graphs are auto-generated for all the selected values. You may want to look at everything when you don't know the root cause of the problem or if you are just doing routine monitoring. But it is better to focus on one port-channel at a time and not get overwhelmed by too much information at the same time. **Details**: - The displayed port-channel utilization is slightly higher than the sum of the utilization of all member ports. This is done to avoid overlapping in the graph by multiplying port-channel utilization by 1.1. You can safely ignore this observation. - The options under *Uplink Port Channel* drop-down are automatically updated based on the selected UCS domain and FI (A or B)

targets.query: SELECT (mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/[[polling_interval]]) AS "TX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]])/(mean("oper_speed")*1000000000) AS "TX %" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000)/(mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000) AS "TX % MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8*1.1/[[polling_interval]]) AS "TX Util" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

SELECT (mean("oper_speed")  *1000000000) AS "TX Util MAX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "port" =~ /^$uplink_pc$/ AND "fi_id" =~ /^$fi_id$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "port" fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-$fi_id $uplink_pc traffic breakdown - TX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization, traffic distribution, top-talkers, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the total traffic on a FI

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth' AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A Ethernet Traffic - RX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization, traffic distribution, top-talkers, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the total traffic on a FI

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth' AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A FC Traffic - RX

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC' AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B FC Traffic - RX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization, traffic distribution, top-talkers, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the total traffic on a FI

panels.title: FI-A FC Traffic - TX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find uplink port utilization, traffic distribution, top-talkers, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the total traffic on a FI

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_tx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "TX" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC' AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B FC Traffic - TX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find server port utilization, top-talkers, traffic distribution among ports and among the two FI, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the combined traffic to/from a chassis. Ideally, all ports connected to the same chassis/IOM should have uniform traffic utilization. **Details**: TX traffic on server ports is inbound to blade servers. Similarly, RX traffic on server ports is outbound from blade servers.

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX" FROM "FIServerPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/  AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),port,to_chassis,to_iom_slot,to_iom_port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A Server port traffic - RX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find server port utilization, top-talkers, traffic distribution among ports and among the two FI, etc. **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current. Utilization of ports are stacked to show the combined traffic to/from a chassis. Ideally, all ports connected to the same chassis/IOM should have uniform traffic utilization. **Details**: TX traffic on server ports is inbound to blade servers. Similarly, RX traffic on server ports is outbound from blade servers.

targets.query: SELECT mean("bytes_rx_delta")  *8/ [[polling_interval]] AS "RX" FROM "FIServerPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/  AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),port,to_chassis,to_iom_slot,to_iom_port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B Server port traffic - TX

panels.description: **Use Case**: Most and least busy UCS chassis, AKA top-talker and bottom-talker chassis **How to use**: Monitor the traffic pattern over time in the graph. Sort by clicking on the avg or current.

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_rx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]] AS "RX Traffic" FROM "VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'Eth') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport,chassis fill(linear)

panels.title: Top Ethernet traffic - Inbound - per chassis breakdown

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]] AS "TX Traffic" FROM "VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport,chassis fill(linear)

targets.query: SELECT sum("bytes_tx_delta") *8/[[polling_interval]] AS "TX Traffic" FROM "VnicStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "transport" = 'FC') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time(1m),transport,domain,chassis,service_profile fill(linear)

panels.title: Top FC traffic - Outbound - per service profile breakdown

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find ingress corrupted packets reported due to CRC mismatch **How to use**: CRC errors are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for CRC errors. Most common are faulty SFP, cables, etc.

targets.query: SELECT mean("crc_rx_delta") AS "RX CRC" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A per port CRC

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find ingress corrupted packets reported due to CRC mismatch **How to use**: CRC errors are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for CRC errors. Most common are faulty SFP, cables, etc.

targets.query: SELECT mean("crc_rx_delta") AS "RX CRC" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B per port CRC

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find packets discarded in RX direction **How to use**: Discards are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for discards. Refer to the documentation for more details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("discard_rx_delta") AS "RX Discard" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A per port RX Discards

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find packets discarded in RX direction **How to use**: Discards are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for discards. Refer to the documentation for more details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("discard_rx_delta") AS "RX Discard" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B per port RX Discards

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find packets discarded in TX direction **How to use**: Discards are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for discards. Refer to the documentation for more details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("discard_tx_delta") AS "TX Discard" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A per port TX Discards

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find packets discarded in TX direction **How to use**: Discards are always bad. Any non-zero reported values should be troubleshooted and resolved. **Details**: There are many reasons for discards. Refer to the documentation for more details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("discard_tx_delta") AS "TX Discard" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B per port TX Discards

panels.description: **Use Case**: Various errors on Fibre Channel Ports **How to use**: It is fine for these counters to increment when the link is coming up but after that these counters should not increment. Packets may be dropped due to these errors. **Details**: Refer to the documentation for details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("link_failures_delta") AS "Link Failures", mean("signal_losses_delta") AS "Signal Losses", mean("sync_losses_delta") AS "Sync Losses" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'A') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-A per port Link failures, Signal losses and Sync losses

panels.description: **Use Case**: Various errors on Fibre Channel Ports **How to use**: It is fine for these counters to increment when the link is coming up but after that these counters should not increment. Packets may be dropped due to these errors. **Details**: Refer to the documentation for details.

targets.query: SELECT mean("link_failures_delta") AS "Link Failures", mean("signal_losses_delta") AS "Signal Losses", mean("sync_losses_delta") AS "Sync Losses" FROM "FIUplinkPortStats" WHERE ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND "channel" != '' AND fi_id = 'B') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),transport,port fill(linear)

panels.title: FI-B per port Link failures, Signal losses and Sync losses
CRC, Discard, Errors, etc. per FI uplink port

panels.description: **Use Case**: Find traffic congestion on FI server ports (between FI and IOM) **How to use**: Unusual PAUSE frame activity on FI server port may indicate traffic congestion. PAUSE frames may be exchanged under normal condition also. So, find unusual PAUSE frame activity with below symptoms (not an exhaustive list): - PAUSE frame rate in tens or hundreds per second is probably fine. Pay attention to thousands or tens-of-thousands per second. Millions per second definitely need investigation. - Look for spike in PAUSE frame rate. Low stable values are probably fine. - Does one port among many other similar ports has higher PAUSE frame activity? For example, does one FI server port (between FI and IOM) stand out than rest of the other ports connected to the same chassis? - Does FI-A see more PAUSE activity than FI-B or vice-versa? Once you have a suspect server port with unusual PAUSE frame activity, continue the troubleshooting on blade servers in the connected chassis to find the ultimate source or destination of the traffic. **Details**: - An IOM fabric port sends PAUSE frames to FI server port if it is unable to receive the traffic at the ingress rate. These frames are reported as RX PAUSE on FI Server port. - Egress traffic on FI server port is inbound to the blade servers. - RX PAUSE on server ports should be monitored for server inbound traffic congestion.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(sum("pause_rx"),1s) AS "PAUSE against Inbound Traffic" FROM "FIServerPortStats" WHERE "domain" =~ /^$domain$/ AND fi_id = 'A' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),port,to_chassis fill(linear)

panels.title: PAUSE against server inbound traffic on server ports

panels.title: PAUSE against server inbound traffic on server ports

list.definition: show tag values from FIEnvStats with key=domain
list.label: UCS Domain
list.name: domain
list.query: show tag values from FIEnvStats with key=domain

list.definition: show tag values from FIUplinkPortStats with key=port where channel = '' and domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/
list.label: Uplink Port Channel
list.name: uplink_pc
list.query: show tag values from FIUplinkPortStats with key=port where channel = '' and domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/

list.definition: show tag values from VnicStats with key=pinned_uplink where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/
list.label: Uplink
list.name: uplink
list.query: show tag values from VnicStats with key=pinned_uplink where domain =~ /$domain/ and fi_id =~ /$fi_id/

list.definition: select location from (select location,last(load) from FIEnvStats where ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/))
list.name: domain_location
list.query: select location from (select location,last(load) from FIEnvStats where ("domain" =~ /^$domain$/))
